google_reviews.author: Luke Rose
google_reviews.review: Latisha and her staff were absolutely wonderful the year I lived here. They have strict rules in place which Makes for a wonderful experience both inside and outside of the apartments. They were very attentive to any fixing needs, usually fixing appliances and such within the hour of me calling them. The recently remodeled apartments are absolutely beautiful inside. I would highly Recommend them to anyone looking for a quiet, nicely kept, and well run apartment complex.

google_reviews.author: John Currier
google_reviews.review: I lived here for 5 years after I got divorced.  It was a great home.  The staff was always wonderful to deal with, and 7 years later they're all still there.  The recent remodel looks wonderful and they make a genuine effort to make everyone feel that this is their home.  The opportunity for a large garden is rare for an apartment, and the grounds are amazing.  Walking trails, an old growth apple orchard, etc.

google_reviews.author: Storrie Morrow
google_reviews.review: My partner and I have lived here for almost 2 years now, and I couldn't have imagined a better place for us to land. The complex has a lot of amenities. I love the sense of community I've felt here. My neighbors and the staff are so welcoming and quick to fix any issues that have come up. And the location in Bellingham is very convenient.

google_reviews.author: Kate Schultehenrich
google_reviews.review: My partner, brother, and I called this complex to gather more information for a 2 bed/1 bath unit as we are planning to move to Washington in the next few months. We were in the process of being put on the wait list when they asked "Will it be a family moving in?" When we explained it would be us three she immediately told us that they wouldn't be able to accept us. We were confused because my partner and I have been living in other apartment units in California together for the past three years and have had no issues regarding us not being a hetero-normative married couple. We further asked why that was an issue and she explained that they've had problems with people breaking leases that made it difficult for the property management. We were trying to explain how discriminatory this sounded while explaining our situation and she said, "Well this isn't the right place for you then" and hung up. I have never had an experience quite as homophobic as this. If possible to give a 0 star I would.

google_reviews.author: Ai Leen
google_reviews.review: The community is okay, amenities are average BUT the manager is RUDE & OBNOXIOUS! She is very condescending, arrogant & really really rude. Walls are thin so be prepared to hear your neighbor snore & other things that happens at night that should be private between couples.

google_reviews.author: Dr Brenda Kotewa
google_reviews.review: The staff here is responsive, friendly, and compassionate. They consider their renters part of their family and plan events accordingly. No discrimination here based on ability, ethnicity, religious beliefs, or gender diversity. Been here five years and no plans to move from this awesome location.

google_reviews.author: Ellie R.
google_reviews.review: The apartment itself is cheaply made and the walls are so thin so you can hear your neighbors even if they are having a normal conversation. The manager and maintenance team are great, though.

summary.text:
Good

Spring Creek Apartments have received several positive remarks in user reviews, particularly highlighting the property’s serene environment and responsive staff. One reviewer noted their satisfaction with the large garden available at the complex, which is not typically found in apartment settings. The walking trails and old growth apple orchard further contribute to the pleasant outdoor atmosphere, making it a desirable place for nature lovers. Additionally, the location in Bellingham is appreciated for its convenience, offering easy access to various amenities and services in the area.

Users have also expressed their appreciation for the sense of community within Spring Creek Apartments. Residents feel welcomed by both their neighbors and the management team, who they describe as friendly and accommodating. The staff is quick to address any issues that arise, often responding to maintenance requests efficiently, which contributes to a positive living experience. The recent remodeling efforts have enhanced the aesthetic appeal of the apartments, adding to the overall satisfaction of the residents.

Great

The property management at Spring Creek Apartments is highly praised for their attentiveness and hospitality. One resident shared how the manager Latisha and her staff created a wonderful living experience by adhering to strict rules that maintain a peaceful environment. The management's swift action in handling maintenance requests within an hour has left a strong impression on the residents, showcasing their commitment to providing excellent service. The beautifully remodeled interiors and exteriors add to the charm, making Spring Creek a coveted place to reside.

Another resident, who has lived at the apartments for five years, commended the management for their consistent efforts in fostering a welcoming atmosphere. The recurring positive interactions with the staff over the years have led to a strong sense of community. This resident highlights how the management plans inclusive events, indicating a genuine effort to include all tenants regardless of their background, further solidifying Spring Creek Apartments as a desirable living space.

Bad

Despite many positive aspects, some user reviews have highlighted certain drawbacks at Spring Creek Apartments. A recurring issue reported by several reviewers is the thinness of the walls, which can lead to unwanted noise disturbances from neighboring apartments. This concern about privacy and noise is something potential occupants might need to consider. Furthermore, although some have praised the management, others have had less fortunate experiences.

Particularly, there's mention of unprofessional behavior from management in specific incidents. One applicant found the management to be unaccommodating during a potential lease signing, which resulted in a negative experience and frustration due to perceived discriminatory practices. Another reviewer noted the dissatisfaction with a noisy replacement fridge and felt the need for improvement in the management's communication regarding such maintenance decisions.

Ugly

Several user reviews have expressed serious concerns regarding discriminatory practices by the management at Spring Creek Apartments. One review details a troubling experience where a potential tenant was denied an apartment due to non-traditional family dynamics, which they perceived as discriminatory and homophobic. This allegation of discrimination is a significant blemish and raises concerns about inclusivity and fairness in the leasing process.

Moreover, there have been instances of alleged rude behavior from the management team, reported by multiple reviewers, which suggest a pattern of poor customer service. One reviewer explicitly described interactions with the manager as condescending and hostile, severely impacting their experience. Such conduct, if prevalent, could deter potential renters and tarnish the property's reputation, highlighting a critical area in need of improvement for the management team.
